publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5419 Peter Peacock: Visit to Scotland by Al Gore—That the Parliament welcomes the visit of Al Gore, former Vice President of the United States of America, to Scotland and commends his work on raising awareness of the issues associated with climate change and global warming; encourages all Scots to read the publication, or see the film, An Inconvenient Truth, and make a commitment to personal action to reduce their carbon impact and combat global warming, and encourages the Scottish Executive to progressively extend actions to reduce carbon emissions and encourage personal action by individual Scots. Supported by: Mr Alasdair Morrison*

S2M-5419 Visit to Scotland by Al Gore (lodged on 16 January 2007) Maureen Macmillan*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Alex Johnstone*, Bruce Crawford*, Bill Butler*, Euan Robson*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Margaret Jamieson*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Donald Gorrie*, Karen Gillon*, Christine May*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Scott Barrie*, Trish Godman*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Marlyn Glen*

S2M-5419 Visit to Scotland by Al Gore (lodged on 16 January 2007) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Chris Ballance*, Cathie Craigie*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Jackie Baillie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Dave Petrie*, Rosie Kane*, Karen Whitefield*

S2M-5419 Peter Peacock: Visit to Scotland by Al Gore—That the Parliament welcomes the visit of Al Gore, former Vice President of the United States of America, to Scotland and commends his work on raising awareness of the issues associated with climate change and global warming; encourages all Scots to read the publication, or see the film, An Inconvenient Truth, and make a commitment to personal action to reduce their carbon impact and combat global warming, and encourages the Scottish Executive to progressively extend actions to reduce carbon emissions and encourage personal action by individual Scots. Supported by: Mr Alasdair Morrison, Maureen Macmillan, Ms Maureen Watt, Alex Johnstone, Bruce Crawford, Bill Butler, Euan Robson, Malcolm Chisholm, Margaret Jamieson, Richard Lochhead, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Donald Gorrie, Karen Gillon, Christine May, Dr Elaine Murray, Scott Barrie, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Jim Wallace, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Marlyn Glen, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Chris Ballance, Cathie Craigie, Ms Wendy Alexander, Jackie Baillie, Marilyn Livingstone, Dave Petrie, Rosie Kane, Karen Whitefield, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-5419 Visit to Scotland by Al Gore (lodged on 16 January 2007) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5419 Visit to Scotland by Al Gore (lodged on 16 January 2007) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-5419 Visit to Scotland by Al Gore (lodged on 16 January 2007) Bristow Muldoon*
S2M-5419 Visit to Scotland by Al Gore (lodged on 16 January 2007) Susan Deacon*
S2M-5419 Visit to Scotland by Al Gore (lodged on 16 January 2007) Cathy Peattie*

S2M-5419 Peter Peacock: Visit to Scotland by Al Gore—That the Parliament welcomes the visit of Al Gore, former Vice President of the United States of America, to Scotland and commends his work on raising awareness of the issues associated with climate change and global warming; encourages all Scots to read the publication, or see the film, An Inconvenient Truth, and make a commitment to personal action to reduce their carbon impact and combat global warming, and encourages the Scottish Executive to progressively extend actions to reduce carbon emissions and encourage personal action by individual Scots. Supported by: Mr Alasdair Morrison, Maureen Macmillan, Ms Maureen Watt, Alex Johnstone, Bruce Crawford, Bill Butler, Euan Robson, Malcolm Chisholm, Margaret Jamieson, Richard Lochhead, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Donald Gorrie, Karen Gillon, Christine May, Dr Elaine Murray, Scott Barrie, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Jim Wallace, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Marlyn Glen, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Chris Ballance, Cathie Craigie, Ms Wendy Alexander, Jackie Baillie, Marilyn Livingstone, Dave Petrie, Rosie Kane, Karen Whitefield, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Jean Turner, Mr David Davidson, Bristow Muldoon, Susan Deacon, Cathy Peattie
